intro: Erysimum bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its distinctive bi-colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers, which range from yellow to orange, are borne in racemes and bloom from late spring to early summer. Erysimum bicolor is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
